questions.prompt: 1. In BG 7.1, Krishna says He will reveal what to Arjuna?
choices: Knowledge of His nature without any doubt
questions.feedback: Krishna promises to reveal knowledge of His transcendental nature and yoga.

questions.prompt: 2. In BG 7.2, how many knowledge categories does Krishna mention?
questions.feedback: Krishna describes eight forms of knowledge including earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intelligence, and false ego.

questions.prompt: 3. In BG 7.4, what is the higher nature of Krishna (compared to the lower material nature)?
choices: His spiritual energy (jiva-bhuta) which sustains all life
questions.feedback: Krishna's higher nature is His spiritual energy which sustains all living entities.

questions.prompt: 4. In BG 7.5, what is the relationship between Krishna and all living entities?
choices: All beings exist in Him like pearls in a string; He is the thread
He is the servant of all
questions.feedback: Just as threads support pearls, Krishna sustains all living entities in the material world.

questions.prompt: 5. In BG 7.6, what two natures does Krishna say comprise the entire cosmic manifestation?
questions.feedback: The superior and inferior energies together form the entire manifestation of the universe.

questions.prompt: 6. In BG 7.7, who ultimately is the source of all existence?
questions.feedback: Krishna says everything rests upon Him; He is the ultimate source and foundation of all existence.

questions.prompt: 7. In BG 7.8, what is Krishna compared to in nature?
choices: The taste of water and the light of the sun and moon
questions.feedback: Krishna is the taste of water, the light of the moon and sun, the sound in the sky, and the ability to hear.

questions.prompt: 8. In BG 7.9, what does Krishna say He is the source of?
choices: Sound in ether, ability to smell in earth, and He is the heat of fire
questions.feedback: Krishna pervades all the senses and sensory objects; He is their ultimate source.

questions.prompt: 9. In BG 7.10, who alone can understand Krishna's transcendental nature?
choices: A loving devotee with full engagement in Krishna consciousness
questions.feedback: Those in Krishna consciousness can understand His transcendental nature and acts.

questions.prompt: 10. In BG 7.14, what does Krishna say is extremely difficult for people in the material world to overcome?
questions.feedback: Krishna's maya (divine illusion) is extremely difficult to overcome; only those devoted to Him can transcend it.

questions.prompt: 11. In BG 7.15, who are the four types of sinful people who approach Krishna?
choices: Those distressed, the curious, the needy, and the wise ones
questions.feedback: Four types seek Krishna: those in distress, the curious, those seeking wealth, and the wise.

questions.prompt: 12. In BG 7.16, which of these four types is the best according to Krishna?
choices: The wise one; he is always engaged in serving Krishna
questions.feedback: The wise one who is always engaged in Krishna's service is the best and is very dear to Him.

questions.prompt: 13. In BG 7.18, which path is considered the best according to Krishna?
questions.feedback: Knowledge of Krishna is supreme; all karma is exhausted when one attains transcendental knowledge.

questions.prompt: 14. In BG 7.19, when can one be said to have gained full knowledge of Krishna?
choices: When one knows Him to be the Lord of all beings, the ultimate controller
questions.feedback: One who knows Krishna as the Lord of all existence and surrenders to Him achieves perfect knowledge.

questions.prompt: 15. In BG 7.20, who are most interested in worshiping Krishna?
choices: Those whose minds are stolen by worldly affairs and those who have exhausted their material desires
questions.feedback: Those absorbed in worldly affairs and those who have attained all material success seek Krishna.

questions.prompt: 16. In BG 7.21-22, to what extent does Krishna grant spiritual wishes to his faithful devotees?
choices: Fully; He gives them faith so they can be steadily devoted
questions.feedback: Krishna fulfills the desires of His devoted followers by making their faith steady.

questions.prompt: 17. In BG 7.23, what is the duration of the fruits of worshiping the demigods compared to worshiping Krishna?
choices: Temporary and perishable; Krishna's devotion is eternal
questions.feedback: Worship of demigods yields temporary results; only Krishna worship leads to eternal reward.

questions.prompt: 18. In BG 7.24, what is the understanding of those who worship demigods instead of Krishna?
choices: They think Krishna is limited and demigods are also supreme powers
They know they are wasting time
questions.feedback: Those worshiping demigods have limited understanding; they don't know Krishna's supreme position.

questions.prompt: 19. In BG 7.25, what is Krishna's nature regarding revealing Himself?
choices: He is revealed only through austerities
He reveals Himself only to His sincere devotees through love and devotion
questions.feedback: Krishna is revealed only to those who are purely devoted to Him in love and affection.

questions.prompt: 20. In BG 7.26, what does Krishna know about all beings?
choices: The past, present, and future of all beings; but no one knows Him
questions.feedback: Krishna is omniscient about all beings past, present, and future, but He remains unknown to all.

questions.prompt: 21. In BG 7.27, what is the cause of the delusion that makes beings forget their eternal nature?
choices: The duality of attraction and repulsion born of desire and hate
questions.feedback: Beings are deluded by the dualities of desire and hatred that cause them to forget Krishna.

questions.prompt: 22. In BG 7.28, what do those who perform pious acts and become free from karma seek?
choices: Worship of Krishna due to being freed from the dualities of delusion
questions.feedback: Those freed from karma and dualities engage in Krishna's worship with determination.

questions.prompt: 23. In BG 7.29, how does Krishna fulfill the desires of those who engage in His service?
choices: He grants them freedom from fear, old age, and death, making them immortal
questions.feedback: Krishna grants those engaged in His service freedom from fear and even immortality.

questions.prompt: 24. In BG 7.30, what is promised to those who remember Krishna at the time of death?
choices: They attain Krishna's nature and go to Him
questions.feedback: Those who remember Krishna constantly, especially at death, attain His transcendental abode.

questions.prompt: 25. In BG 7 (summary), what is the main teaching of Chapter 7?
choices: Knowledge of Krishna's transcendental nature and how to unite with Him
questions.feedback: Chapter 7 reveals Krishna's divine nature and how sincere devotion leads to Him.
